title: Set of Zines: Women of NASA
creator: Maryann Riker; Nancy Scott
subject: science space; mathematics; photo zines
description: Celebrating the women of NASA who put men in space and on the moon, these 5 zines honor those who worked behind the scenes, became astronauts and lost their lives in the pursuit of science. This one-sheet book structure with various pink-shaded-cardstock covers also includes an acrostic poem by Nancy Scott of Easton, Pa.

title: Landscapes of the Late Anthropocene
creator: Philip Zimmermann
subject: climatology, agricultural sciences, geology, digital prints
description: This book presents images meant to invoke a future dystopian watery world as brought about by climate change.
materials: hardcover boards; pigmented archival inkjet; foil stamp

title: Attempted Fix: Dams, Bases and the Resulting Wobbles
creator: Tyler Starr
subject: pamphlets; hydrology; political science
description: This book explores cross-relationships between the anti-dam and anti-U.S. military base protest movements in Japan.

title: Living Locally
creator: Erica Van Horn
subject: sociology, linguistics, geography, paperbacks
description: This book selects entries from a daily journal written over five years about rural life in and around a farming valley in Tipperary, Ireland, to the north of the Knockmealdown Mountains.

creator: Emily Van Kley
subject: contact prints; science space
description: This book contains a poem about going to Mars.
materials: arches text wove paper; lama li paper

title: Kandze Village Bodhisattva: Nine Iterations
creator: Clifton Meador
subject: philosophy; sociology; geography; pamphlets
description: This book explores ideas of iteration and repetition that are connected to the practice of traditional Tibetan book production.

title: Home Planetarium Survey
creator: Heidi Neilson
subject: science space; astronomy; photogram
description: This book displays seven toy planetariums and photograms of the constellation Orion as projected by the planetariums.

title: God's Femur; an anatomy lesson
creator: Ward Schumaker
subject: pamphlets; anatomy; philosophy
description: This book follows the story of a young artist who is hustled through the basement of the shopping center that is host to the Nebraska Governor's Annual Art Competition in 1965.
publisher: San Fransisco Center for the Book

title: Sure as Death
creator: Willyum Rowe
subject: offset lithography; public health; mortality
description: In this book, the author cut up an old Victorian book and rearranged the type and pictures to make a poetic and tragic story about the decimation caused by HIV in the gay community in the early nineteen eighties.

title: Best Laid Plans
creator: Katie Garth
subject: psychology; digital print
description: This book work explores daily routine as a coping mechanism for chaos and uncertainty, depicting disembodiment as an abstract and ethereal escape.

title: Recipes for Disaster
creator: Barabara Ciurej; Lindsay Lochman
subject: digital print; climatology; geography; oceanography
description: This book discusses the climate crisis, as told through risk-laden desserts.

title: Head Lines: Worlds Warning
creator: Bea Nettles
subject: digital print; public health; epidemiology
description: In this book, the author creates headlines from 2020 following the COVID-19 pandemic from photographs taken in cemetaries of people's surnames that are also parts of speech.

title: Reading Rights
creator: Mary Marsh
subject: pamphlets; political science
description: This book presents our First and Fourth Amendment rights in four bookmarks presented as a pamphlet binding with library book pocket

title: Toxic Kids
creator: Lise Melhorn-Boe
subject: pamphlets; human physiology; toxicology; synthetic textiles
description: This paper doll book contains photocopies of hand-drawn doll clothes found at a flea market, with hand written text on the clothing about toxins in the environment that adversely affect children.
materials: Boise HDP color copy paper; color copy cove paper

title: Invitation
creator: Sandy Tilcock
subject: hydrology; accordian folding
description: This book displays photos of the Willamette River.

title: Pansy's Hexagons, Honeycombs & Grandmother's Flower Garden
creator: Elsi Vassdal Ellis
subject: sociology; agricultural sciences; brochures
description: This book presents the author's grandmother's story from 1898 to 1936 is presented here in a hexagonal format, one of her favorite quilt shapes.

title: Field Work
creator: Rhiannon Alpers
subject: accordian folding; plant biology (botany)
description: This book features four women naturalists of the 1900’s and gives a brief poetic biography of the women and their field of expertise, with silhouette imagery of the species the women researched and published work relating to.

title: Covid Times
creator: Denise Stephenson
subject: digital print; public health; epidemiology; sociology
description: This book captures moments of blurred time during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Charms for Hemlock
creator: Anna Lena Phillips Bell
subject: plant biology (botany); paperbacks
description: This book contains two poems written by the author for hemlock in North Carolina.

title: Galileo's Drawings of our Sun's Spots (1612)
creator: Billy O'Callaghan
subject: accordian folding; astronomy and astrophysics
description: This book presents Galileo's 35 drawings of the sun's spots made during June and July of 1612.
